clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: ACR 20)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: DAS28 ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding and lack of allocation concealment.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Remission (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: DAS28-ESR <2.6)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding and lack of allocation concealment.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Disability (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding and lack of allocation concealment.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

population: Patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Quality of life (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: RAQol (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID 2)
